intro: Teline linifolia subsp. gomerae, commonly known as the Gomeran linseed plant, is a rare and endemic species native to the Canary Islands. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid and sunny conditions of its native habitat. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various insects and birds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
